intro: Sarcotheca paniculata, commonly known as the panicled sarcotheca, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive paniculate inflorescence, which consists of a branched cluster of small flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that enclose its seeds, a feature typical of the genus Sarcotheca. It is native to tropical regions and thrives in humid, warm climates. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
